SEARCH
Module se1.bestellsystem
Package components

Interface Validator

public interface Validator
Public interface of component to validate parameters for creating objects of datamodel classes. Interface is primarily used by DataFactory.
Version:
"F12-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT"
Author:
"sgraupner"

  • Method Details

    • validateOrderCreationDate

      Optional<LocalDateTime> validateOrderCreationDate(LocalDateTime date)
      Validate order creation date against bounds lowerOrderCreationDate ("Jan 01, 2020 00:00") and upperOrderCreationDate ("Dec 31, 2099 23:59").
      Parameters:
      date - date to validate
      Returns:
      validated date or empty result

    • validateContact

      Optional<String> validateContact(String contact)
      Validate contact for acceptable email address or phone number and return contact or empty result.
      Rules for validating a email addresses and phone numbers are defined by regular expressions:
      • email address: "^[a-z0-9._%+-]+@[a-z0-9.-]+\\.[a-z0-9_]+$".
      • phone number: "^(phone:|fax:|\\+[0-9]+){0,1}\\s*[\\s0-9()][\\s0-9()-]*".
      • leading and trailing white spaces [\s], commata [,;] and quotes ["'] are trimmed from contacts before validation.
      Parameters:
      contact - contact to validate
      Returns:
      possibly modified (e.g. dequoted, trimmed) valid contact or empty result

    • validateName

      Optional<String> validateName(String name, boolean acceptEmptyName)
      Validate name and return name or empty result. A valid name must start with a letter, followed by a combination of letters, "-", "." or white spaces. Valid names are: "E", "E.", "Eric", "Ulla-Nadine", "Eric Meyer", "von-Blumenfeld". Names do not include numbers or other special characters.
      Rules for validating a name are defined by a regular expression:
      • "^[A-Za-z][A-Za-z-\\s.]*$".
      • leading and trailing white spaces [\s], commata [,;] and quotes ["'] are trimmed from names before validation, e.g. " 'Schulz-Müller, Tim Anton' ". 
       Examples:
 +------------------------------------+---------------------------------------+
 |name to validate                    |valid, possibly modified name          |
 +------------------------------------+---------------------------------------+
 |"Eric"                              |"Eric"                                 |
 |"Ulla-Nadine"                       |"Ulla-Nadine"                          |
 |"E", "E.", "von-A"                  |"E", "E.", "von-A"                     |
 +------------------------------------+---------------------------------------+

 Trim leading, trailing white spaces and quotes:
 +------------------------------------+---------------------------------------+
 |"  Anne  "   (lead/trailing spaces) |"Anne"                                 |
 |"  'Meyer'  "   (quotes)            |"Meyer"                                |
 +------------------------------------+---------------------------------------+
      Parameters:
      name - name to validate
      acceptEmptyName - accept empty ("") name, e.g. as first name
      Returns:
      valid, possibly modified (e.g. dequoted, trimmed) name or empty result

    • validateSplitName

      Optional<components.Validator.NameParts> validateSplitName(String name)
      Split single-String name into first and last name parts and validate parts, e.g. "Meyer, Eric" is split into first: "Eric" and last name: "Meyer".
      Rules of splitting a single-String name into last- and first name parts:
      • if a name contains no seperators (comma or semicolon [,;]), the trailing consecutive part is the last name, all prior parts are first name parts, e.g. "Tim Anton Schulz-Müller", splits into first name: "Tim Anton" and last name: "Schulz-Müller".
      • names with seperators (comma or semicolon [,;]) split into a last name part before the seperator and a first name part after the seperator, e.g. "Schulz-Müller, Tim Anton" splits into first name: "Tim Anton" and last name: "Schulz-Müller".
      • leading and trailing white spaces [\s], commata [,;] and quotes ["'] are trimmed from names before validation, e.g. " 'Schulz-Müller, Tim Anton' ".
      • interim white spaces between name parts are removed, e.g. "Schulz-Müller, <white-spaces> Tim <white-spaces> Anton <white-spaces> ". 
       Examples:
 +------------------------------------+-------------------+-------------------+
 |Single-String name                  |first name parts   |last name parts    |
 +------------------------------------+-------------------+-------------------+
 |"Eric Meyer"                        |"Eric"             |"Meyer"            |
 |"Meyer, Anne"                       |"Anne"             |"Meyer"            |
 |"Meyer; Anne"                       |"Anne"             |"Meyer"            |
 |"Tim Schulz‐Mueller"                |"Tim"              |"Schulz‐Mueller"   |
 |"Nadine Ulla Blumenfeld"            |"Nadine Ulla"      |"Blumenfeld"       |
 |"Nadine‐Ulla Blumenfeld"            |"Nadine‐Ulla"      |"Blumenfeld"       |
 |"Khaled Mohamed Abdelalim"          |"Khaled Mohamed"   |"Abdelalim"        |
 +------------------------------------+-------------------+-------------------+

 Trim leading, trailing and interim white spaces and quotes:
 +------------------------------------+-------------------+-------------------+
 |" 'Eric Meyer'  "                   |"Eric"             |"Meyer"            |
 |"Nadine     Ulla     Blumenfeld"    |"Nadine Ulla"      |"Blumenfeld"       |
 +------------------------------------+-------------------+-------------------+
      Parameters:
      name - single-String name to split into first- and last name parts
      Returns:
      record with valid, possibly modified (e.g. dequoted, trimmed) first and last name parts or empty result
